info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 1:44PM CDT until August 31 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN MITCHELL AND SOUTHERN SCURRY COUNTIES... At 144 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms have produced heavy rain near Ira. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Highway 1606 east of Ira has been closed due to water running over the road. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Colorado City Airport, Inadale, Dunn, Buford, Ira, Hermleigh and Cuthbert. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
